title: pyRDDLGym: From RDDL to Gym Environments. (arXiv:2211.05939v4 [cs.AI] UPDATED)
abstract: We present pyRDDLGym, a Python framework for auto-generation of OpenAI Gym environments from RDDL declerative description. The discrete time step evolution of variables in RDDL is described by conditional probability functions, which fits naturally into the Gym step scheme. Furthermore, since RDDL is a lifted description, the modification and scaling up of environments to support multiple entities and different configurations becomes trivial rather than a tedious process prone to errors. We hope that pyRDDLGym will serve as a new wind in the reinforcement learning community by enabling easy and rapid development of benchmarks due to the unique expressive power of RDDL. By providing explicit access to the model in the RDDL description, pyRDDLGym can also facilitate research on hybrid approaches for learning from interaction while leveraging model knowledge. en_tdlr: pyRDDLGym is a Python framework for auto-generation of OpenAI Gym environments from RDDL declarative description. It describes the discrete time step evolution of variables in RDDL using conditional probability functions, and supports easy modification and scaling up of environments. It enables rapid development of benchmarks and facilitates research on hybrid approaches for learning from interaction with model knowledge.
